comments:
Product: Eclipse 2.1.2
Platform: Red Hat Linux release 9 (Shrike)
Java:1.4.2_01

Install eclipse, edit preferences, set classpath variables, create 15 projects
(for each of our java component), exit, start eclipse: everything ok. (Problem
#0: had to use 'apply' button to commit settings, 'ok' didn't work.)

Exit Eclipse. Copy over .project and .classpath files (since we got tons of
settings in each project). Start eclipse. All preferences and projects gone.
Problem #1: the.classpath and .project that we copied over with was saved on
windows, along with crlf.

Set environment and classpath variables. Create one project. Exit eclipse.
Copy over .classpath and .project, make sure they are in unix format (set
fileformat=unix in vi). Start eclipse, everything ok.

Create 2 more projects. Repeat previous step. Start eclipse. All projects gone
and preferencs lost. This is problem #2 (blocker). Similar procedure works for
out windows guys. Not sure what keeps bombing my setup.

I am not sure what the behaviour is here for R3.0 and whether there have been 
any changes, but this is an issue for the Core team not UI.
Any exceptions in the log file when this happens?

Hello,
I have the same problem: "preferences", "project properties" and the "help 
topics" are missing. When I try to open the preferences, my log give me the 
following error:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Mrz 29, 2004 13:03:27.231

I'm using Eclipse 2.1.2, too on a SuSE 8.2 OS. Thank to all for help...

No more information from originator (stack trace provided by Thomas is unrelated).

Please re-open if you still experience the same problems with the latest builds
and are able to provide steps to reproduce it.
